name: International Aid Charity
mission: International Aid Charity (IAC) provides emergency and ongoing aid relief, education, orphan sponsorship and social support services to marginalized peoples throughout the world. Our donors and volunteers work directly with communities to offer both physical and emotional health through education, housing and vocational training for orphans and widows, sports and creative arts programs. IAC offers a foundation of hope and resources upon which those in need can build and thrive.
theoryOfChange: Providing a foundation of hope through education, housing, and vocational training to allow those in need to build and thrive.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://iacharity.org/zakat (Source: https://iacharity.org/zakat)

dimension_explanations.alignment: IAC shows strong alignment with humanitarian causes and Muslim donor needs, offering clear zakat-eligibility and multiple ways to contribute, including volunteering and direct donations [2][4][5]. The focus on urgent humanitarian needs and orphan support reflects a high donor fit for those prioritizing social justice and emergency relief [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through direct provision of services, maintaining a total revenue of $1,481,959 with 87.8% of expenses dedicated to programs like Gaza Civilian Aid Relief [1][3]. Its financial health is robust, characterized by 4.4 months of working capital and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised [1].

The organization is verified as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various asnaf categories [2].

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should address its missed BBB standards, particularly regarding board oversight and effectiveness reporting.

rich_narrative.headline: International Aid Charity (IAC) provides essential humanitarian relief and social support services to marginalized communities through a highly efficient financial model.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support rapidly growing humanitarian efforts in critical crisis zones like Gaza and Syria, and who prioritize zakat-eligible direct aid.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations for emergency relief
Care deeply about civilian aid in Gaza and Syria
Value organizations with high fundraising efficiency
giving_considerations: The program expense ratio is currently reported at 87.8%
The organization is still developing its governance to meet full BBB standards
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors who require strict adherence to all BBB governance standards or demand a program expense ratio above the industry standard of 75%.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C indicates that outcomes are reported but lack rigorous external evaluation or long-term tracking.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Delivers emergency food, relief services, and trauma-informed education to displaced populations.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that interventions in complex humanitarian crises are actually improving beneficiary lives rather than just delivering outputs.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a 69.7% revenue CAGR, the organization is in a rapid growth phase and can absorb additional funding for its expanding crisis response programs.

strengths.detail: The organization operates with a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring development costs do not drain resources.
IAC has demonstrated a robust <cite id="3">3-Year Revenue CAGR of 69.7%</cite>, indicating rapidly expanding donor support.
The charity is verified as <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite> and directs funds to appropriate asnaf categories.

strengths_deep_dive: International Aid Charity has established a strong trajectory of financial growth, evidenced by its <cite id="3">3-Year Revenue CAGR of 69.7%</cite> and reaching <cite id="3">$1,481,959 in total revenue</cite> in 2023. This growth is supported by an incredibly lean development model, boasting a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. Furthermore, the organization maintains a solid financial safety net with <cite id="1">4.4 months of working capital</cite>, allowing it to respond to emergencies without immediate cash flow crises.
rich_narrative.summary: International Aid Charity (IAC) is a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing emergency relief, orphan sponsorship, and educational support to marginalized communities globally. Operating across multiple crisis zones, the organization delivers vital programs including <cite id="2">Gaza Civilian Aid Relief</cite> and <cite id="2">Refugee Schools</cite>. In 2023, IAC reported <cite id="3">$1,481,959 in total revenue</cite>, demonstrating significant growth with a <cite id="3">3-Year Revenue CAGR of 69.7%</cite>. The charity maintains a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, indicating highly streamlined development operations. However, its reported <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 87.8%</cite> falls below the <cite id="1">peer program ratio median of 89.8%</cite>. The organization holds an <cite id="1">overall score of 87.87.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> and has earned a Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid. For Muslim donors, IAC is verified as <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite>, serving eligible asnaf categories including <cite id="2">fuqara and masakin</cite> across regions such as Syria, Gaza, and Yemen. While the organization shows strong financial resilience with <cite id="1">4.4 months of working capital</cite>, it currently meets only <cite id="1">6 of 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance standards</cite>, indicating room for governance and effectiveness reporting improvements.
